# Welcome to the R-Bootcamp! {.unnumbered}

This course leverages a technology called `webr` that lets you run R in your browser. 

Keep in mind that it can take a little time before you can run the exercises. Wait for the spinner to finish before you start working on exercises.

## Acknowledgements {.unnumbered}

The R-Bootcamp has gone through many revisions and technologies. 

It is authored by [Ted Laderas](https://laderast.github.io) and [Jessica Minnier](http://jessicaminnier.com/)

Includes contributions from: Chester Ismay, Eric Leung, Aurora Blucher, Tracy Edinger, Dian Chase, Gabrielle Choonoo, Clint Olson, Michael Kolesnikov, Joshua Meyer, amundhb, cfiller123, and Ines Montani.

We utilize datasets from the gapminder and fivethirtyeight packages.

Portions of this Bootcamp were adapted from a workshop I gave with Chester Ismay: <https://github.com/Cascadia-R/gRadual-intRoduction-tidyverse>
